translations.text: (O Prophet), surely We have granted you a clear victory<sup foot_note="181455">1</sup>

so that Allah may forgive you your shortcomings, whether earlier or later,<sup foot_note="181456">1</sup> and may complete His favours upon you<sup foot_note="181457">2</sup> and guide you to the Straight Way,<sup foot_note="181458">3</sup>
and that Allah may bestow upon you a mighty help.<sup foot_note="181459">1</sup>

He it is Who bestowed inner peace on the hearts of the believers<sup foot_note="181460">1</sup> so that they may grow yet more firm in their faith.<sup foot_note="181461">2</sup> To Allah belong the legions of the heavens and the earth; Allah is All-Knowing, Most Wise.<sup foot_note="181462">3</sup>

(He did this) to admit the believers, both men and women,<sup foot_note="181463">1</sup> to Gardens beneath which rivers flow, wherein they shall abide, and to efface their evil deeds from them.<sup foot_note="181464">2</sup> That, in Allah's sight, is the supreme triumph.

(He also did this) to chastise the hypocrites, both men and women, and those who associate others in His Divinity, both men and women, and who harbour evil thoughts about Allah.<sup foot_note="181465">1</sup> They shall be afflicted with misfortune,<sup foot_note="181466">2</sup> Allah is wroth with them. He has laid His curse upon them and has prepared for them Hell. What an evil end!
To Allah belong the legions of the heavens and the earth. Allah is Most Mighty, Most Wise.<sup foot_note="181467">1</sup>
(O Prophet), We have sent you forth as a witness,<sup foot_note="181468">1</sup> as a bearer of good news, and as a warner<sup foot_note="181469">2</sup>
so that (all of) you may all believe in Allah and His Messenger, and support him, and revere him, and celebrate Allah's glory, morning and evening.<sup foot_note="181470">1</sup>

Those who swore fealty to you, (O Prophet),<sup foot_note="181471">1</sup> in fact swore fealty to Allah. The Hand of Allah is above their hands.<sup foot_note="181472">2</sup> So whoever breaks his covenant breaks it to his own hurt; and whoever fulfils the covenant that he made with Allah,<sup foot_note="181473">3</sup> He will bestow on him a great reward.

(O Prophet), the bedouins who were left behind say to you:<sup foot_note="181474">1</sup> “We were occupied with our goods and families. So ask forgiveness for us.” They say with their tongues what is not in their hearts.<sup foot_note="181475">2</sup> Say to them: “Who can be of any avail to you against Allah if He should intend to cause you any harm or confer upon you any benefit?” Allah is well aware of all that you do.<sup foot_note="181476">3</sup>

(But the truth is not what you say.) You had imagined that the Messenger and the believers would never return to their families, and this notion was embellished in your hearts.<sup foot_note="181477">1</sup> You harboured an evil thought, and you are an immensely evil people.”<sup foot_note="181478">2</sup>
As for those who do not believe in Allah and His Messenger, for such unbelievers We have prepared a Blazing Fire.<sup foot_note="181479">1</sup>
To Allah belongs the kingdom of the heavens and the earth. He forgives whom He pleases and chastises whom He pleases. He is Most Forgiving, Most Compassionate.<sup foot_note="181480">1</sup>

When you press forth for the spoils, those who were left behind will say: “Let us accompany you.”<sup foot_note="181481">1</sup> They want to change the command of Allah.<sup foot_note="181482">2</sup> Say to them (in clear words): “You shall not accompany us. Thus has Allah already said.”<sup foot_note="181483">3</sup> Then they will say: “Nay; but you are jealous of us.” The truth is that they understand little.

Say to the bedouins who were left behind: “You will be called against those who possess great might and be asked to fight against them unless they surrender.<sup foot_note="181484">1</sup> If you obey (the command to fight), Allah will bestow upon you a goodly reward. But if you turn away, as you turned away before, He shall inflict upon you a grievous chastisement.”

There is no blame on the blind, nor on the lame, nor on the sick (if they do not go forth to fight).<sup foot_note="181485">1</sup> Allah will admit those who obey Allah and His Messenger to the Gardens beneath which rivers flow and will inflict a grievous chastisement on those who turn away.

Allah was much pleased with the believers when they swore fealty to you under the tree.<sup foot_note="181486">1</sup> He knew what was in their hearts. So He bestowed inner peace upon them<sup foot_note="181487">2</sup> and rewarded them with a victory near at hand
and with abundant spoils which they shall acquire.<sup foot_note="181488">1</sup> Allah is Most Mighty, Most Wise.

Allah has promised you abundant spoils which you shall acquire.<sup foot_note="181489">1</sup> He has instantly granted you this (victory)<sup foot_note="181490">2</sup> and has restrained the hands of people from you<sup foot_note="181491">3</sup> that it may be a Sign for the believers<sup foot_note="181492">4</sup> and He may guide you to a Straight Way.<sup foot_note="181493">5</sup>
He also promises you other spoils which you have not yet taken, but Allah has encompassed them.<sup foot_note="181494">1</sup> Allah has power over everything.
Had the unbelievers fought against you at that time, they would have turned their backs (in flight), and would have found none to protect or help them.<sup foot_note="181495">1</sup>
Such is Allah's Way that has come down from the past.<sup foot_note="181496">1</sup> Never shall you find any change in the Way of Allah.
He it is Who restrained their hands from you, and your hands from them in the valley of Makkah, even though He had made you victorious against them. Allah was watching all that you did.

They are the ones who disbelieved and barred you from the Inviolable Mosque and prevented the animals you had designated for sacrifice from reaching the place of their offering.<sup foot_note="181497">1</sup> If it had not been for the believing men and believing women (who lived in Makkah and) whom you did not know, and had there not been the fear that you might trample on them and unwittingly incur blame on their account, (then fighting would not have been put to a stop. It was stopped so that) Allah may admit to His Mercy whomsoever He pleases. Had those believers been separated from the rest, We would certainly have inflicted a grievous chastise-ment on those of them [i.e. the Makkans) who disbelieved.<sup foot_note="181498">2</sup>

(This is why) when the unbelievers set in their hearts a fierce bigotry � the bigotry of ignorance<sup foot_note="181499">1</sup> � Allah bestowed inner peace upon His Messenger and upon the believers<sup foot_note="181500">2</sup> and made the word of piety binding on them. They were more deserving and worthier thereof. Allah has knowledge of everything.

Allah indeed showed His Messenger the true vision,<sup foot_note="181502">1</sup> one fully in accord with reality. If Allah so wills<sup foot_note="181503">2</sup> you shall certainly enter the Inviolable Mosque, in full security,<sup foot_note="181504">3</sup> you will shave your heads and cut your hair short,<sup foot_note="181505">4</sup> and do so without any fear. He knew what you did not know, and He granted you a victory near at hand even before (the fulfilment of the vision).

He it is Who sent His Messenger with the True Guidance and the Religion of Truth that He may make it prevail over every religion. Sufficient is Allah as a witness (to this).<sup foot_note="181506">1</sup>

Muhammad is Allah's Messenger, and those who are with him are firm with the unbelievers<sup foot_note="181507">1</sup> but compassionate with one another.<sup foot_note="181508">2</sup> You see them occupied in bowing and prostrating and in seeking Allah's bounty and good pleasure. They are distinguished<sup foot_note="181509">3</sup> from others by the marks of prostration on their faces. Thus are they described in the Torah.<sup foot_note="181510">4</sup> And their parable in the Gospel is that of<sup foot_note="181511">5</sup> a tilth that puts forth its shoot, then strengthens it so that it becomes stout and stands firmly on its stem. This is a sight pleasing to the sowers and one by which the unbelievers will be enraged. As for those who believe and do righteous deeds, Allah has promised them forgiveness and a great reward.<sup foot_note="181512">6</sup>
